item.title: GTA 6 Police Chase Leak Reveals Stunning Realism and Advanced Gameplay Features - Techstory
item.description:
GTA 6 Police Chase Leak Reveals Stunning Realism and Advanced Gameplay Features

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Not specified

The recent leak of footage showcasing a police chase in Grand Theft Auto 6 has stirred excitement among fans, highlighting the game's exceptional realism and advanced physics.

  • The leaked video features a thrilling police chase, emphasizing realism with detailed collision effects.
  • Fans noted realistic interactions with the environment, including tree branches reacting to impacts.
  • Rockstar's commitment to merging cinematic cutscenes and gameplay promises an immersive experience.
  • Concerns have been raised about potentially curated footage, with fans cautioning high expectations.
  • In related news, Rockstar has continued its crackdown on unauthorized mods, including the takedown of Liberty City Preservation Project.
“The leaked footage has left fans with high hopes for GTA 6. With its emphasis on realism, advanced physics, and immersive gameplay, Rockstar seems poised to deliver a groundbreaking title.”

While waiting for official announcements, anticipation around GTA 6 is mounting as fans hope it will meet their high expectations.

item.title: Nintendo Switch 2 Desktop mode, keyboard & mouse support for Call of Duty and other games leaked - Sportskeeda
item.description:
Nintendo Switch 2 Desktop mode, keyboard & mouse support for Call of Duty and other games leaked

Date & Source: Not specified

Call of Duty leaker Shaun Weber hinted at a Desktop Mode for Nintendo Switch 2, allowing players to use mouse-like controls for a PC-like experience on the go.

  • The Joy-Con controllers may work as a mouse using an optical sensor.
  • Native keyboard support is expected, facilitating competitive play against PC players.
  • This feature aligns with Nintendo's intentions to cater to a more hardcore gaming audience.
"Switch 2... 'Desktop mode', Joy-Con Mouse... More games with Native Mouse n Keyboard support like future Call of Duty titles"

Additionally, there are suggestions of future COD titles being better able to fit on the Nintendo Switch 2 along with support for other shooter games like Metroid Prime and BioShock titles.

Nintendo's upcoming Direct showcase in April 2025 may reveal more about these features.

item.title: Weight loss resolutions don’t work – focusing on health and well being can be better - Scroll.in
item.description:
Weight Loss Resolutions Don't Work – Focus on Health and Well-Being Instead

Publication Date: January 2025 Source: The Conversation

This article discusses the limitations of weight loss resolutions and advocates for a weight-neutral approach to health and well-being. It emphasizes the importance of self-compassion and a holistic view of health over traditional diet culture.

  • January is a common time for setting health-related resolutions.
  • Diet culture promotes unrealistic ideals and equates thinness with health.
  • Weight-neutral resolutions prioritize feeling good and functioning well over losing weight.
  • Research suggests that weight loss efforts often fail due to factors beyond personal control.
  • Healthy resolutions could include walking, prioritizing sleep, or enhancing social connections.
“When we broaden our perspective beyond how our bodies look, it’s possible that resolutions for the new year can create energy and excitement for what’s to come.”

In conclusion, setting resolutions based on holistic well-being rather than weight loss can lead to more fulfilling and sustainable health improvements.

item.title: Android co-founder to Bill Gates: So, sorry Bill, you're more responsible for Microsoft losing the $400 billion than you realize - The Times of India
item.description:
Android co-founder to Bill Gates: So, sorry Bill, you're more responsible for Microsoft losing the $400 billion than you realize

Publication Date: [Date Not Provided] Source: [Source Not Provided]

This article discusses a statement made by an Android co-founder addressing Bill Gates regarding Microsoft's significant financial losses. The author argues that Gates plays a larger role in these losses than he acknowledges.

  • The Android co-founder critiques Microsoft's management under Gates.
  • The discussion revolves around a $400 billion loss.
  • The commentary highlights past decisions made by Microsoft that may have contributed to these losses.
“So, sorry Bill, you're more responsible for Microsoft losing the $400 billion than you realize.”

The article invites readers to consider how leadership decisions impact large corporations.

item.title: Deals: Realme GT 7 Pro price drops, Redmi Note 14 series launches with some discounts - GSMArena.com news - GSMArena.com
item.description:
Deals: Realme GT 7 Pro price drops, Redmi Note 14 series launches with some discounts

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

The Realme GT 7 Pro sees a significant price drop from its initial launch discount and the Redmi Note 14 series arrives with various models and pricing.

  • The Realme GT 7 Pro is now available with a €180 discount, featuring a Snapdragon 8 Elite performance, 6.78” LTPO OLED display, and a 6,500mAh battery with 120W charging.
  • The Realme GT 6T offers a competitive price at €380 with good performance and features, albeit with a lesser chip.
  • The Redmi Note 14 Pro+ features Snapdragon 7s Gen 3 with 120W fast charging and comes in multiple configurations.
  • Redmi Note 14 Pro offers similar specs as Pro+ but at a lower price with different chipset options.
  • Different variants in the Redmi Note 14 series provide various features, price points, and performance ratings, including a 4G model with a Helio chip.
“We may get a commission from qualifying sales.”

This pricing shift represents consumer-friendly adjustments in the highly competitive smartphone market as brands aim to attract more customers.

item.title: How a little-known Finnish co became one of the world’s hottest gadget startups - Mint
item.description:
How a little-known Finnish company became one of the world’s hottest gadget startups

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Company Business News

In the startup world, smart-ring pioneer Oura is a rare beast. It isn’t just a unicorn valued at more than $5 billion, but also profitable in a uniquely unforgiving realm: consumer electronics.

Oura’s smart ring is on its fourth iteration, and millions of people rely on it for tracking their health. The ring gathers data 24/7, providing wearers with helpful insights into their health.

  • Oura monitors health metrics such as heart rate, skin temperature, and movement.
  • The device calculates a “readiness score” for users each morning.
  • The insights are derived from a significant amount of health data, including contributions from 70,000 users.
  • The technology enables early predictions of illness before symptoms are displayed.
"The ring gathers data 24/7, its wearers wake up to a 'readiness score' that factors in everything from how they slept to evidence they might be feeling stressed."

Oura exemplifies innovation in health tracking, establishing a presence as a leading gadget startup in a competitive market.

item.title: How a little-known Finnish company became one of the world’s hottest gadget startups | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
How a Little-Known Finnish Company Became One of the World’s Hottest Gadget Startups

Publication Date: Current Date & Source: Company Business News

In the startup world, Oura stands out as a profitable unicorn in the competitive consumer electronics market. Their smart ring has gained millions of users by focusing on health tracking rather than just fitness metrics.

  • Oura is valued over $5 billion and remains profitable.
  • The smart ring tracks heart rate, skin temperature, and movement.
  • It provides users with a “readiness score” based on comprehensive health data.
  • Insights are derived from a vast health data pool, contributed by over 70,000 users.
  • The ring can predict when wearers may be getting sick.
"Users wake up to a 'readiness score' that factors in sleep quality and stress levels."

The Oura smart ring is transforming how individuals approach health monitoring, signaling a new direction in consumer electronics.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg Announces the End of Smartphones and the Rise of Their Revolutionary Replacement - The Daily Galaxy --Great Discoveries Channel
item.description:
Mark Zuckerberg Announces the End of Smartphones and the Rise of Their Revolutionary Replacement

Date: Not specified. Source: Not specified.

Introduction: Mark Zuckerberg, the CEO of Meta, shares his vision that smart glasses will replace smartphones as the primary device for communication within the next decade, coinciding with increased investments in augmented reality technology.

  • Smartphones have dominated technology for 30 years, revolutionizing communication and productivity.
  • Market saturation and slow innovation in smartphones raise questions about better ways to integrate technology.
  • Smart glasses promise hands-free interaction and a more integrated digital experience.
  • Companies like Meta, Apple, and Google are heavily investing in the development of smart glasses.
  • Advancements in technology like AR, battery life, AI, and 5G are critical for smart glasses' success.
  • Zuckerberg predicts a shift to smart glasses as the primary digital interaction tool by the 2030s.
“Computing should be natural and technology should blend into the background of daily life.”

Conclusion: If Zuckerberg's prediction holds, the 2030s could signify a transformative era where technology becomes less intrusive and more integrated into our daily lives.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S24 5G Plus Gets Massive Discount On THESE Platforms During Republic Day Sale; Check Deals - Zee News
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy S24 5G Plus Gets Massive Discount On THESE Platforms During Republic Day Sale; Check Deals

Date: January 22, 2025 Source: Zee News

The Samsung Galaxy S24 5G Plus receives significant discounts on Amazon and Flipkart during the Republic Day sale, just days before the launch of the Galaxy S25 series. The price reductions make the flagship model more accessible to buyers.

  • The Samsung Galaxy S24 Plus 5G (256 GB) originally priced at Rs 99,999 is discounted to Rs 64,999 on Amazon, a 35% discount.
  • Amazon includes a cashback offer of Rs 1,949 for Amazon Pay transactions and exchange offers up to Rs 53,200 for old smartphones.
  • On Flipkart, the same model is available for Rs 59,999, reflecting a 40% discount.
  • Flipkart offers 5% cashback with Flipkart Axis Bank Credit Card and exchange values up to Rs 38,150.
“Original price was Rs 99,999; now available at Rs 64,999 on Amazon.”

These discounts provide substantial savings for customers looking to purchase a premium smartphone, highlighting the competitive market just before the launch of new models.

item.title: Do you have persistent bad breath? Doctor shares how it may be related to your gut: 'Instead of using mouthwash…" - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Do you have persistent bad breath? Doctor shares how it may be related to your gut: 'Instead of using mouthwash…'

Date: Jan 18, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

This article discusses the potential causes of persistent bad breath and its possible connections to gut health, hydration, and oral microbiome.

  • Persistent bad breath may indicate an issue with gut health or dehydration.
  • Dr. Shirley Koeh emphasizes visiting a dentist if bad breath persists despite good oral hygiene practices.
  • Mouthwash can kill both harmful and beneficial bacteria; using oral probiotics is recommended instead.
  • Hydration is crucial for maintaining oral health and preventing bad breath.
  • The oral microbiome is linked to gut health; addressing gut issues may resolve bad breath directly.
“Having yourself hydrated constantly can help with your problem of bad breath.” - Dr. Shirley Koeh

In conclusion, maintaining good oral hygiene, staying hydrated, and paying attention to gut health are essential for preventing persistent bad breath.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S25 series prices leak ahead of January 22 launch event - India Today
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy S25 Series Prices Leak Ahead of January 22 Launch Event

Published On: Jan 18, 2025 | Published By: Aman Rashid

The Galaxy S25 series, set to launch on January 22, is anticipated to see a price increase compared to the previous Galaxy S24 lineup, with significant changes in storage and RAM configurations.

  • The Galaxy S25 base model starts at Rs 84,999, a jump from last year's Rs 74,999.
  • The Galaxy S25+ will begin at Rs 1,04,999, up from Rs 99,999.
  • Galaxy S25 Ultra's starting price is expected at Rs 1,34,999, compared to Rs 1,29,999 for the S24 Ultra.
  • The higher production costs related to the new Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset may contribute to the pricing increase.
“Whether this performance boost justifies the price increase remains to be seen.”

As the launch date nears, Samsung is accepting pre-bookings, indicating strong interest despite higher pricing expectations.

item.title: Santosh Kamath of Franklin Templeton MF is back with a new credit AIF - Mint
item.description:
Santosh Kamath Launches New Credit Alternative Investment Fund

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Mint

Santosh Kamath, former head of fixed income at Franklin Templeton MF, is back with a new private credit alternative investment fund (AIF) after a notable exit from six debt funds worth ₹25,000 crore in 2020.

  • Kamath transitioned to lead the newly formed alternatives business in 2023.
  • His leadership during the winding up of the debt funds has been a significant part of his career.
“I am excited to bring new opportunities to investors through this alternative investment fund.” - Santosh Kamath

This new fund aims to provide diverse investment opportunities amid changing market dynamics.

item.title: Santosh Kamath of Franklin Templeton MF is back with a new credit alternative investment fund | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Santosh Kamath of Franklin Templeton MF is back with a new credit alternative investment fund

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Mint

Santosh Kamath, the fixed-income chief at Franklin Templeton MF, returns with a new private credit alternative investment fund after dismantling six debt funds in 2020 that totaled ₹25,000 crore.

  • Kamath was responsible for managing the six debt funds when they were wound up.
  • He stepped down from his role in 2023 to lead the newly established alternatives business.
“Unlock Premium Insights in This Article”

This new development reflects a significant shift in strategy as Kamath aims to leverage alternative investment opportunities in the current market landscape.

item.title: ChatGPT's new feature, Nvidia's healthcare AI, and Synthesia's millions: This week's AI launches - Quartz
item.description:
This week's AI launches: ChatGPT tasks, Nvidia's healthcare AI, and Synthesia's funding

Date: Current Date
Source: Quartz

This week featured significant updates from ChatGPT, Nvidia, and Synthesia in the AI landscape. Notable advancements include ChatGPT's beta tasks feature, Nvidia's healthcare partnerships, and Synthesia's Series D funding.

  • OpenAI launched a beta feature in ChatGPT enabling users to schedule tasks for reminders and actions.
  • Nvidia partnered with key healthcare leaders to enhance drug discovery and patient care using AI.
  • Synthesia secured $180 million in a Series D funding round, boosting its valuation to $2.1 billion.
“AI offers an exceptional opportunity to advance healthcare and life sciences...” - Kimberly Powell, Nvidia
“This new investment will help us develop a new generation of AI-powered video experiences...” - Victor Riparbelli, Synthesia

The developments highlight the rapid advancements in AI technology and its applications across various industries.

item.title: OnePlus Open 2: Leak reveals design of world's thinnest foldable smartphone - Notebookcheck.net
item.description:
OnePlus Open 2: Leak reveals design of world's thinnest foldable smartphone

Date: 2025-01-18 Source: Notebookcheck

A new leak has surfaced detailing the upcoming OnePlus Open 2, touted as the world’s thinnest foldable smartphone, set to launch internationally following its debut in China.

  • The Oppo Find N5 will launch as the OnePlus Open 2.
  • The design features a circular camera module similar to the OnePlus 13.
  • The phone measures less than 9.2mm when folded and about 4mm when unfolded.
  • The device will be available in multiple colors and aims for minimal display crease.
“The Find N5 will likely dethrone the Honor Magic V3 in terms of thickness.”

The OnePlus Open 2 promises to innovate with its design and minimal display crease, indicating significant advancements in foldable technology.
